properties.name: Tappy Plane
properties.description: Tap to keep your plane in the air and make your way through the cave system. Get as far as you can before you crash in to a wall, submit your score, and try again.

events.comment: Clicking on the start button object changes the opacity variable to 1, which allows the below event to begin, which increases the opacity of Rect_black
When the Opacity of the Rect_black object reaches 255, the scene changes

Variable meaning
ObstacleCollision: This checks if the player was in collision with an obstacle
GameplayStarted: This checks if the game has started
New_hscore: This checks if the player has a new highscore and displays the "New_hscore" sprite
Transition fade, when the Rect_Black object reaches 0 opacity it is deleted
Add force to the pillars for a horizontal movement
Jump if space key is pressed or click on right button on mobile
Create pillars at a random position
Show outline on score text as it changes it's value each time a point is earned
Add a point to the player score once the player passes both pipes
Save the players score once it's greater than the previous score
Read the storage and store value in a scene variable "score"
Apply offset to the tiled sprites "Ground" and "Ceiling" so they look like they're moving in game
End game once player is in collision with an obstacle
Game over events run only on game over/game not running
Display a "High_Score_Changed" text object once player has a new highscore
When the player clicks on "Restart_Game_button", while the "Gameover" layer is visible, change the scene to "Game" to restart the scene
When the player clicks on "Share_button", while the "Gameover" layer is visible, hide "Gameover" layer and show "SubmitScore" layer

When the player clicks on "Submit_Score_button", while the "SubmitScore" layer is visible, send the scene variable "Score" and the text typed in to the text input object "PlayerName_Input" to the leaderboard

Then display and begin loading that leaderboard, and hide the "SubmitScore" layer so the player can't press the submit button again.
When the leaderboard has finished loading and is displayed over the game, change the scene to "Leaderboard"
When the leaderboard is exited, the below event will trigger and send the player back to the "Game" scene, which will have started over so the player can try again.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on X axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeX

propertyDescriptors.label: Amplitude of the movement on Y axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: AmplitudeY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime
